description: Dive into "Whispers of Love in Bern's Heart" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Whispers of Love in Bern's Heart

places.generalDescription: The Cathedral of Bern, a stunning example of late Gothic architecture, is an absolute must-see when exploring the Old Town. Standing tall at 100 meters, it proudly holds the title of Switzerland's tallest cathedral. Its impressive bell tower features a massive bell that weighs around 10 tons and has a diameter of about 2.5 meters. While the interior may appear understated, visitors are captivated by its exquisite stained glass windows and antique furnishings that tell stories from centuries past.

sources.snippet: If you‚Äôre visiting for a short time and don‚Äôt know what to see in Bern in 1 day, check out this cathedral in the Old Town, built in the late Gothic style. It is the highest church in the country with a bell tower 100 meters high and a huge bell with a diameter of about 2.5 m and weighing 10 tons. The interior decoration is not rich, but still interesting with its stained glass windows, antique furniture and bas-relief composition.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Bern in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: The Cathedral of Bern is Switzerland‚Äôs tallest church, featuring an impressive spire rising to over 100 m. The Gothic structure is of marvelous architectural beauty and offers some of the most beautiful ceiling paintings and windows in the world. But the Berner M√ºnster, as it is known in German, also offers fantastic views from its accessible clock tower which make coming here a highlight for the panorama alone.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to do in Bern (Switzerland)

sources.snippet: Switzerland‚Äôs tallest cathedral went up gradually during the 15th and 16th centuries. The single spire soars to more than 100 metres and unless you‚Äôre a bit squeamish about heights you should have no hesitation conquering the 400-odd steps to view the distant, snow-capped Alps. But before you do that, the Last Judgement will greet you as you enter.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Bern (Switzerland)

sources.snippet: Of all the places with beautiful views in Bern, it‚Äôs Bern Cathedral that I found the most breathtaking. It has the tallest viewing deck within the old city of Bern, nearly 100 meters or 330 feet high. Up on the terrace of the church‚Äôs spire, a 360-degree panorama of the entire city awaits you.
sources.shortName: 7 Most Beautiful Views In Bern (With Google Maps Links)

sources.snippet: Bern Cathedral (Berner M√ºnster): The Bern Cathedral is the tallest cathedral in Switzerland, showcasing impressive Gothic architecture. Its intricate fa√ßade, stained glass windows, and the towering spire offer panoramic views of the city and the distant Alps.
sources.shortName: Romantic Beauty And Adventure In Switzerland's Heart
One Day in Bern Itinerary: A Delightful Medieval Day Trip

places.name: Cathedral of Bern

reviews.text: One of Bern's must-see sites. Though renovations were in progress when we visited, you could still access some parts of the Cathedral and witness its beauty. The stained-glass windows, vaulted ceilings, and stone and wood carvings serve as testament to the majesty of Switzerland's gothic architecture.

Bern Cathedral (Berner M√ºnster)
Standing as the tallest cathedral in Switzerland, the Bern Cathedral is also known as the Berner M√ºnster and is one of the city's most iconic landmarks. Construction began in 1421 in the Gothic style and continued in stages for several centuries. Its 100-meter (328-foot) spire was only completed in 1893, and today it offers panoramic views over the city of Bern, the Aare River, and even the snow-capped Alps on clear days.

Located at the edge of the UNESCO-listed Old Town, the cathedral is both an architectural masterpiece and a spiritual center. The interior is majestic, featuring soaring ribbed vaults, elegant stained-glass windows, and intricate choir stalls carved from oak. One of the most remarkable features is the main portal, adorned with over 200 stone figures depicting the Last Judgment, which is an incredibly detailed and rare example of late Gothic sculpture in Switzerland.

The cathedral played a central role during the Reformation and has remained a Protestant church since the 16th century. Despite this, much of its original Catholic iconography and artistry was preserved, making it a fascinating site for both religious and historical exploration.

Visitors can climb 344 steps to the top of the tower for a breathtaking 360-degree view of Bern and the surrounding landscape. Inside, occasional concerts are held, utilizing the cathedral's grand organ, which is among the largest in Switzerland.

Whether you're interested in architecture, history, or simply looking to enjoy stunning views, the Bern Cathedral is worth the visit.

**‚õ™‚ú® Awe-Inspiring Moments at Bern Cathedral! ‚ú®‚õ™**

Just stepped inside the **Bern Cathedral (Berner M√ºnster)**-Switzerland's tallest cathedral-and I'm utterly speechless! üòç Soaring **100 meters high**, this Gothic masterpiece took my breath away with its intricate stone carvings, towering spire, and the **stunning stained glass windows** that bathe the nave in kaleidoscope colors. üåà

Don't miss the **Last Judgment sculpture** above the main portal-a jaw-dropping work of medieval art with over 200 figures! And if you're up for a climb, the **344-step tower ascent** rewards you with sweeping views of Bern's red rooftops, the Aare River, and the snow-capped Alps in the distance. üèîÔ∏èüì∏

**Pro tip**: Visit early to avoid crowds, and wear comfy shoes for the tower climb (totally worth it!). The cathedral's peaceful interior is free to enter, but toss a few coins for the tower-it supports preservation! üíô

places.generalDescription: Bern Old Town, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, is a charming medieval center with arcaded walkways and cellar shops. The town boasts Switzerland's tallest cathedral and is surrounded by turquoise waters. Visitors can explore the cobbled streets, small wish fountains, and preserved statues while browsing through quaint bookstores and cafes. The town's clock tower, Zytglogge, is a focal point where tourists gather to watch its revolving figures twirl before the chimes begin.

sources.snippet: Browse through the charming little shops in Bern‚Äôs UNESCO-listed Old Town looking for the perfect birthday present for your best friend or take a stroll through Bern‚Äôs weekly produce market to pick up some regional products for your barbecue, such as vegetables, meat, or fish ‚Äì shopping in Bern is simply fun!. And best of all: the six-kilometre-long arcades protect you from the blazing sun or from sudden summer thunderstorms.
sources.shortName: Summer in Bern - Bern Welcome

sources.snippet: Together with your partner, enjoy discovering intriguing sites and hearing breathtaking stories through which Bern is brought closer to you and your loved one.Start the journey from the iconic Old Town of Bern, a UNESCO World Heritage Site where centuries of history unfold in a unique way. Witness symbolic landmarks, including the Parliament buildi...
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Bern - Bern

places.name: UNESCO - Bern Old Town

reviews.text: The Bern old town is lovely, colorful and very easy to walk around, even if it's raining ‚òîÔ∏è there pathways next to the shops covered, as is UNESCO protected the buildings are old but very well maintained, you will be impressed! Many fountains to see and take pics with and of course the famous clock tower! You will need a couple of hours to stroll around the historical center, watch out for the trams and red buses are very frequent! Recommend it and take your time to enjoy it!

If you love historic buildings, Bern's Old City is a must-see. The medieval architecture is stunning, and the streets are beautifully clean and well-organized. Shops are thoughtfully placed, so you can enjoy the views while exploring. A truly charming and unforgettable experience!

In my opinion, Bern's old town is one of the most beautiful and compact in the world. Its specialty is the arcades formed by the old buildings lining the streets. The arcades are lined with shops, restaurants, bars, art galleries, etc. It is worth walking around the old town, also along the banks of the Aare River, and climbing to the Rosengarten to admire the magnificent view of the old town. Every time I visit Bern I feel amazed.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the picturesque city of Bern, Restaurant Rosengarten offers a delightful dining experience within a city park. With its Mediterranean cuisine and an extensive wine selection, this hidden gem provides a laid-back atmosphere and a terrace with stunning panoramic views. The restaurant is celebrated for its Swiss culinary delights and international dishes, catering to all palates including vegetarian options.

sources.snippet: The city‚Äôs rose garden is on high ground, close to the B√§renPark and with a very satisfying vista of Bern‚Äôs Old Town from the right bank of the Aare. Families, friends and couples come to meet up and take picnics with Bern at their feet. This piece of open land was a cemetery up to 1913, and the first of its roses were planted in 1917.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Bern (Switzerland)

places.name: Restaurant Rosengarten

reviews.text: We had the Angus Beef steak and a salad. The steak was very juicy and the seasoning is perfect. The salad and homemade balsamic vinega was also very fresh. The service was also very good. All of the staffs were very nice and very kind. We were very happy to have our lunch here. Definitely recommend.

Very nice park at the top of Bern city, offering a place to rest and fantastic view. The restaurant is ideal to take a break from a walking tour, having all the city in "the plate". Very nice place for panoramic photos of the city and the river. A must visit

We were not able to have a table by the side, with the amazing view as we had not made a reservation. We came here on a whim.

We were given 2 other seating options, 1 which we were warned we would be hit by the sun soon and the other on the other side near the kids playground on the high chair stools and table.

The waitress who served us was super busy, there was a large party of 10 or so and lots of other small tables she was serving. She did her best to keep everyone happy. There was a bit of a wait time to order.

Once the food came, it tasted good.
However due to being summer, wasps started to appear and take over.

The toilets are inside, downstairs, they were clean.
Upon exiting the building we saw a huge amount of salad plates ready to go just sat on the side.

Overall, it was good.

places.generalDescription: Universit√§t Bern Botanical Garden, established in 1860, is a green oasis just a short walk from the main train station. It is home to around 5,500 native and exotic plants, offering a peaceful retreat for nature enthusiasts and anyone seeking tranquility in the city. Divided into four sections - alpine, Mediterranean, subtropical, and Arboretum - the garden showcases an impressive collection of plants from around the world.
places.name: 25- Universit√§t Bern Botanical Garden

reviews.text: A nice place to stay in the nature if you don't want to go far. Special flowers, smells, insects, cool tiny paths make this garden a, special place

Such a lovely, calm and beautiful place to spend your day. It's along the Aare river, with lots of trees and plants around, where you can just lay down and chill. You can enter for free.
There's also a cute cafe to get coffee and small food. Highly recommended for a picnic and relaxing day:)

This place is one of the hidden gems in Bern. It is seldom mentioned on tourist attraction websites. You will see locals wandering the medicinal plant and the herb areas, students having a picnic lunch and of course a lot of resident lizards and insects enjoying the lush vegetation. All the plants are very well labelled with botanical information, you never have to wonder what you are looking at. I will return to the Universit√§t Bern Botanical Gardens every time I visit or pass Bern since it is only 5 minutes walk from the main station.

places.generalDescription: Church of the Holy Spirit is an impressive 18th-century Baroque-style church adorned with sandstone pillars. Located on the commercial side of the city, it stands across from the Main Train Station and is hard to miss. The interior boasts unique lighting and a surprisingly low ceiling, making it a worthwhile visit for its architectural and historical significance. While not as ornate as Berner Munster, it remains one of the most beautiful churches from the late Baroque period.

sources.snippet: In the 13th century there was a small chapel on this site, of which only the bell has survived since its destruction. The reviews note the impressiveness of the structure, built in the Baroque style. The restraint, and at the same time the elegance of the interior is emphasized by the circular gallery of arches and massive columns of sandstone, elegantly decorated with stucco elements.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Bern in 2024 (Lots of photos)

sources.snippet: The Holy Ghost Church (Heiliggeistkirche): Known for its significant size and baroque style, the Holy Ghost Church is one of the largest Swiss Reformed churches in Switzerland. Its plain exterior contrasts with a richly decorated interior, including an impressive organ.
sources.shortName: Romantic Beauty And Adventure In Switzerland's Heart

places.name: Church of the Holy Spirit

reviews.text: Beautiful old church built in the 18th century, stands right in the square on Spitalgasse. One of the largest Reformed churches in Switzerland.

Landmark site right in the heart of Switzerland's capital city. Besides being a church with distinctive Gothic architecture, the place also hosts cultural events. üá®üá≠ ‚õ™Ô∏è

If you're up for a walk in this UNESCO World Heritage city, turn sharply to your left once you spot this site.  ‚¨ÖÔ∏è
There was fool left on the side door steps. For the homeless. They seem to collect money for the poor but the poor walk around the building drunk and drugged. A very surreal atmosphere

places.generalDescription: In the heart of Bern's Old Town, the Zytglogge, or Clock Tower, is a historic landmark dating back to 1405. This 12-meter-high tower features mechanical moving figures that come to life on the hour, including a parade of bears, a jester, a golden rooster, and Chronos, the god of time.

sources.snippet: Erected at the end of the 12th century as Bern‚Äôs western city gate, this tower in the Old Town has become an icon for an extraordinary clock that was installed in 1530. One of the oldest in Switzerland, this measured standard time in the Canton of Bern, and has an astounding astronomical clock below. Get to Marktgasse on the stroke of the hour for a little show when some of the earliest examples of automata come alive beside the astrolabe.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to Do in Bern (Switzerland)

sources.snippet: Zytglogge is part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site ‚ÄúOld City of Bern‚Äù and is one of the main landmarks of the city serving many different purposes throughout its history. The Zytglogge was used as a guard tower, clock tower, as well as a prison. One of the highlights of the tower is its huge astronomical clock that characterizes its fa√ßade.
sources.shortName: 15 Best Things to do in Bern (Switzerland)

sources.snippet: Zytglogge (Clock Tower): The Zytglogge is a landmark medieval tower in Bern‚Äôs Old Town, known for its astronomical clock built in the early 15th century. This ornate clock is a masterpiece of early timekeeping technology and is adorned with moving figurines that perform at each hour.
sources.shortName: Romantic Beauty And Adventure In Switzerland's Heart

sources.snippet: Built in the 12th century, Zytglogge is located on Marktgasse, and is one of the oldest pieces of architecture in this city. When the astronomical clock added to the tower in the 16th century begins to strike every hour, the mechanical figures show up for a mini show.
sources.shortName: 17 Best things to do in Bern, Switzerland (2024)
One Day in Bern Itinerary: A Delightful Medieval Day Trip

sources.snippet: One of the most popular historical attractions is the still-working Zytglogge ‚Äì an astronomical clock built as the city‚Äôs main clock in 1530. Given the Swiss reputation for quality time-pieces, it‚Äôs not surprising that it‚Äôs still working.
sources.shortName: 7 Free Things to do in Bern, Switzerland

places.name: Zytglogge

reviews.text:
Zytglogge is one of the most iconic historical landmarks in the old town of Bern, Switzerland. With centuries of history behind it, this ancient clock tower is not only a stunning piece of architecture but also a living testament to the city's rich cultural heritage.
One of the most fascinating features is the mechanical show that takes place every hour - a charming spectacle of bells and figures that draws the attention of visitors and locals alike. Surrounded by cobblestone streets and beautifully preserved medieval buildings, the area around Zytglogge feels like stepping back in time.
Zytglogge is more than just a photo spot - it's a place where you can truly feel the heartbeat of history in the middle of the city. If you visit Bern, this landmark is absolutely worth seeing.

Zytglogge in Bern is one of those places that catches your eye even if you're not looking for it. It's an old clock tower right in the middle of the old town, and the first time I saw it, I just stood there staring for a bit-it's that striking. The big astronomical clock face, the golden details, and the little figures that move when the hour strikes-it all has this old-world charm that makes you feel like you've stepped back in time.

What I loved most was how it's just part of the street, not tucked away or behind gates. Locals walk by like it's nothing, but as a visitor, you really appreciate how much history is packed into that spot. The street around it is full of arcades, little shops, caf√©s, and those classic Bernese buildings with red roofs and green shutters. I caught the clock show on the hour, and though it's short and simple, it was fun to see the mechanical figures come to life.

If you're wandering through Bern, you'll probably pass it anyway, but it's worth pausing for. Zytglogge isn't just a landmark-it's a lovely little moment of Bern's character and history.

üï∞Ô∏è‚ú® Stepping Back in Time at Bern's Zytglogge Clock Tower! ‚ú®üï∞Ô∏è**

Just witnessed the **Zytglogge**-Bern's iconic medieval clock tower-come to life, and it's like watching history dance before your eyes! üé≠‚è≥ Dating back to the **13th century**, this UNESCO gem isn't just a pretty face; its **astronomical clock** (built in 1530!) puts on a mesmerizing show every hour with jousting knights, dancing bears, and a crowning rooster. üêª‚öîÔ∏è

Climb the **130+ spiral steps** for a behind-the-scenes peek at the **intricate clockwork mechanism**-a marvel of medieval engineering! From the top, soak in 360¬∞ views of Bern's red-roofed Old Town and the Aare River's turquoise embrace. üåäüè∞

**Pro tip**: Time your visit for the **hourly show** (stay for the *full 4 minutes!*), or book a guided tour to unlock secrets of the tower's role as a prison, guard post, and even a fire lookout! üî•üóùÔ∏è

places.generalDescription: Gurtenfestival is a unique music festival that takes place in Bern, attracting over 80,000 fans from around the world. With over 60 bands and 60 DJs performing across four stages, the festival offers a diverse range of genres from local music to rock and R&B. In addition to the music, attendees can enjoy delicious food, drinks, and breathtaking views of the city. The festival also features bars, a fireplace for grilling, and environmental protection initiatives.

sources.snippet: Gurtenfestival: July ‚Äì Set on the Gurten Hill, this is one of Switzerland‚Äôs most popular music festivals. It offers a mix of international and Swiss music across various genres, along with panoramic views of Bern.
sources.shortName: Romantic Beauty And Adventure In Switzerland's Heart

places.name: Gurtenfestival

reviews.text: One of the best festival venues I've ever visited, located on the hills with breathtaking views over the city. The only challenge is to get up there and back with the cable car- there were pretty long queues. But the overall experience is definitely worth it.
Great experience, wonderful location.
I could not give 0 stars... otherwise I would! The worst festival (organisation wise) I've ever been to.

sources.snippet: The best way to get to Bern by car is to take the A1 motorway. The journey from Zurich takes about 1 hour and 30 minutes, depending on traffic. There are also several parking options in Bern's city center.
sources.shortName: Tripper - Guide - A romantic day trip to Bern, Switzerland

reviews.text:
Super friendly person !
Didnt have to wait so he can check the problem and find solution !! Super efficient and very professional.
Very happy to have this garage in my contact.
This is one of the greatest place we found which is readily available and owner was so much polite and very good at work. perfect service
unexpected helpful, highly recommend!

places.generalDescription: Located in Bern, the K√§figturm is a 49-meter baroque tower with a clock and bell. It has a rich history dating back to the 13th century and has primarily functioned as a prison. The area around K√§figturm is bustling with activity, including a daily market at B√§renplatz where visitors can enjoy colorful flowers and fresh fruits. The tower is part of UNESCO heritage in Bern and offers an hourly display that adds to its charm.

sources.snippet: K√§figturm (Prison Tower): The K√§figturm is another medieval tower that once served as a prison. Its historical significance and distinctive structure make it a notable architectural feature in the city‚Äôs skyline.
sources.shortName: Romantic Beauty And Adventure In Switzerland's Heart

places.name: Cage Tower

reviews.text:
First impression - stunning tower!!!
The Kafigturm was used to the town gate between 1250 to 1350. In between 1643 & 1897, this tower was used as a prison. Nowadays, it's being used as the venue for political events or meetings.
We couldn't stop taking lots of pictures here! This is a must see when you come to Bern!

*üè∞üîí Unlock History at Bern's K√§figturm! üîíüè∞**

Step into Bern's medieval past at the **K√§figturm** (Prison Tower)-a stone sentinel that's guarded the city since the **13th century**! üìú‚ú® Once a grim prison and city gate, this towering landmark now bridges history and modernity with its **political exhibitions** and thought-provoking art displays. üé®üóùÔ∏è

Don't miss:
‚úîÔ∏è The tower's **ancient stone walls** and original prison cells-whispers of Bern's darker days.
‚úîÔ∏è Rotating exhibits on **Swiss democracy** and social issues (free entry!).
‚úîÔ∏è The iconic **clock and bell** atop the tower, a timeless symbol of Bern's heritage. ‚è∞
‚úîÔ∏è **Marktgasse** just below-a bustling street perfect for coffee, souvenirs, or people-watching! ‚òïüõçÔ∏è

**Pro tip**:
- Climb the tower's narrow staircase for a **bird's-eye view** of Bern's rooftops and the Parliament Building nearby.
- Pair your visit with a stroll to the **Zytglogge** (just 5 mins away!) for a full medieval immersion. üèÉ‚ôÇÔ∏è
- Visit during **Art Nights** or cultural events when the tower hosts live debates or installations! üé≠

A historic landmark in Bern that has played diverse roles since its construction in the 13th century, including serving as a prison, a clock tower and a treasury. üá®üá≠ üè∞

In the past 25 years, the tower has evolved into a cultural and political hub, hosting numerous exhibitions and events focused on civic engagement, and dialogue - thus becoming a true democracy tower! ü§ù üó£Ô∏è üí≠

PS: Once a year, the "carnival bear" is awakened from its hibernation and freed from its cage in the K√§figturm, marking the official opening of Bern's carnival festivities. üé≠ ü•≥ üß∏"

places.generalDescription: Nestled in Helvetiaplatz 4 in Bern, the Alpine Museum of Switzerland is a captivating institution delving into the intricate connection between mountains and people, culture, and nature in the Swiss Alps. It offers an unconventional exhibition on mountains worldwide, covering diverse topics such as climate change, glaciers, avalanches, mountain farming, tourism, and traditions. The museum provides an interactive platform for discussions while emphasizing the impact of mountains on humanity globally.

sources.snippet: What to remember:  The Alpine Museum of Switzerland admission ticket is not included in the ticket and costs 18 Swiss Francs per adult (17+), free entry for children (age 0-11) and 6 Swiss Francs per teenager (age 12-16)It‚Äôs recommended to wear comfortable shoes and clothes that suit the weather conditions
sources.shortName: 2-hour romantic tour in Bern - Bern

places.name: Alpine Museum of Switzerland

reviews.text: The best museum I have ever been to. The branding is excellent, all the posters, postcards, magazines. They get it. The exhibitions were so insightful, and a special mention to the lost and found collection, a really unique interesting room that also allows you to craft your own repair kits for free. Loved the alps sticker I got too! My favourite place in Bern!

Unfortunately, extremely underwhelming giving the bold name and steep price. This 'alpine museum' has a rather large restaurant, a large rotating exhibition hall, and a smaller exhibition room that was closed when I visited. The museum does not feature exhibits on traditional Alpine culture, sports, or development over the years . The temporary exhibition present was alright, but I read through every plaque and was complete within 20 minutes. For 18 CHF it's a bit of a waste of money - You're better off going across the road and paying the same amount to visit the outstanding Historical Museum of Bern, which has enough to keep you occupied for at least 2 hours.

Admittedly, this review is only for the current exhibition about Alpine crafts. There are one or two good Interactive exhibits but on the whole I felt that I had paid admission to see a product display from Swiss manufacturers.

places.generalDescription: Einstein House, located in Bern, is a second-floor flat where Albert Einstein lived with his spouse from 1903 to 1905. The apartment has been transformed into a museum and showcases period furniture, books, and photographs that offer visitors a glimpse into the life of the famous scientist. Nearby, the Einstein Museum provides detailed information about Einstein's theories and life for science enthusiasts. Additionally, visitors can explore the Bern Historical Museum to learn more about Einstein's legacy.

sources.snippet: The house that he rented is is located along Kramgasse and it has been refurbished to resemble the original atmosphere and turned into a museum. If you are not sure whether you should stop there, I will only say that this is the house where Einstein has developed his Theory of Relativity, so that alone makes it worth a visit.
sources.shortName: 17 Best things to do in Bern, Switzerland (2024)

sources.snippet: The Einstein House: While not grandiose, the Einstein House is significant for its association with Albert Einstein, who lived there while working at the Bern Patent Office. It‚Äôs a typical Bernese residence from the period and has been preserved to reflect the early 20th-century style.
sources.shortName: Romantic Beauty And Adventure In Switzerland's Heart

sources.snippet: Want to know what to see in Bern that is ordinary and memorable?. Visit the Einstein Museum, even if you‚Äôre a complete inexperienced in the theory of relativity. The exhibition reproduces the era of the genius physicist, introduces his theory, and tells about his family.
sources.shortName: Top 20 places to visit in Bern in 2024 (Lots of photos)

places.name: Einstein House

reviews.text: Nice little find on our day trip to Bern.  If you like history and want to learn a little about Einstein I would check it out. I learned a lot about Einstein.  I didn't know he had kids.

Awesome place but its so hot inside  during warm season  to read all the informations.
The room with video does not have windows because it has projector and screen. But its worth for a visit.

Ok. Nothing special but a nice pit stop in the historical place were Einstein composed and developed some of his ground breaking theories. The appartment decorated with some of his stuff is very small and an extra floor has been renovated with the storyline on the walls and some tools.  The affordable price to enter combined with the short time to see compensated the visit.
